agents.name: Send a message
agents.description:
Posts a message to a public channel, private channel, or direct message/IM channel.

Link to documentation: https://api.slack.com/methods/chat.postMessage

Required scope: chat:write

local.final_payload:
=REJECT(
  LOCAL.all_options,
  LAMBDA(
    item,
    OR(
      item = NULL,
      IF(
        OR(
          TYPE(item) = "TrueClass",
          TYPE(item) = "FalseClass",
          TYPE(item) = "Integer"
        ),
        IS_EMPTY(TEXT(item)),
        IS_EMPTY(item)
      )
    )
  )
)

options.subject: Detection Alert
options.body:
Project Name: <>
Time(epoch): <>
Computer Name:<>
Source IP: <>
Username: <>
File Path: <>
Command Line: <>
Sensor ID: <>

Detection Link: <>

agents.name: User Prompt
agents.description: To either isolate a machine or not

options.submissionMessage: Thank you for your response. Please close this window.

Link to documentation: https://api.slack.com/methods/chat.postMessage

action_inputs.name: Channel / User ID
action_inputs.description: You can use a channel name (like ‘#general’) or an ID (like ‘C1234567890’). For non-public channels, specify the ID; this includes private channels, multi-person direct message channels (use the group ID), or DMs to a specific user (use the user ID).

action_inputs.name: Message
action_inputs.description: Use plain text, or [Slack formatting markup](https://slack.com/help/articles/202288908-Format-your-messages#Markup).
action_inputs.value: "The computer <<retrieve_detection.body.detect.routing.hostname>> has not been isolated. Please investigate further if needed."

action_inputs.name: Icon emoji
action_inputs.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message (i.e. :chart_with_upwards_trend:). Overrides Icon URL input.

action_inputs.name: Icon URL
action_inputs.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message.

action_inputs.name: Link names?
action_inputs.description: Find and link user groups. No longer supports linking individual users; use syntax shown in [Mentioning Users](https://api.slack.com/reference/surfaces/formatting#mentioning-users) instead.

action_inputs.name: Markdown
action_inputs.description: Select 'no' to disable Slack markup parsing. Enabled by default.

action_inputs.name: Parse
action_inputs.description: Change how messages are treated. See [further details](https://api.slack.com/methods/chat.postMessage#formatting).

action_inputs.name: Thread timestamp
action_inputs.description: Provide another message's ts value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's ts value; use its parent instead.

action_inputs.name: Unfurl links?
action_inputs.description: Select 'yes' to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

action_inputs.name: Unfurl media?
action_inputs.description: Select 'no' to disable unfurling of media content.

action_inputs.name: Username
action_inputs.description: Specify your bot's username that will send the message.

action_inputs.name: Metadata
action_inputs.description: JSON object with event_type and event_payload fields, presented as a URL-encoded string. Metadata you post to Slack is accessible to any app or user who is a member of that workspace. ex: {"event_type": "task_created", "event_payload": { "id": "11223", "title": "Redesign Homepage"}}

action_inputs.name: Send reply to channel?
action_inputs.description: Used in conjunction with input 'Thread timestamp' and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to false.

action_inputs.name: Channel / User ID
action_inputs.description: You can use a channel name (like ‘#general’) or an ID (like ‘C1234567890’). For non-public channels, specify the ID; this includes private channels, multi-person direct message channels (use the group ID), or DMs to a specific user (use the user ID).

action_inputs.name: Message
action_inputs.description: Use plain text, or [Slack formatting markup](https://slack.com/help/articles/202288908-Format-your-messages#Markup).
action_inputs.value:
"Project Name: <<retrieve_detection.body.cat>>
Time (epoch): <<retrieve_detection.body.detect.routing.event_time>>
Computer Name:<<retrieve_detection.body.detect.routing.hostname>>
Source IP: <<retrieve_detection.body.detect.routing.int_ip>>
Username: <<retrieve_detection.body.detect.event.USER_NAME>>
File Path: <<retrieve_detection.body.detect.event.FILE_PATH>>
Command Line: <<retrieve_detection.body.detect.event.COMMAND_LINE>>
Sensor ID: <<retrieve_detection.body.routing.sid>>
Detection Link: <<retrieve_detection.body.link>>"
